<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.09

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Arrays

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts the supplied [[Array]] of [[Number|Numbers]] into a [[String]]. <br>
The numbers in the array to be converted are the decimal [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode Unicode] representations of characters.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command expects array of numbers. If array contains non-number values, the following error might appear in .rpt file: <tt>Bad conversion: scalar</tt></value></part></template> 

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''toString''' array

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[toString]] [65,97,338];</code> returns "AaŒ"
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>["test","test"] [[joinString]] [[toString]] [12345] [[splitString]] [[toString]] [12345]; // ["test","test"]</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[set]], [[resize]], [[reverse]], [[select]], [[in]], [[find]], [[toArray]], [[forEach]], [[count]], [[deleteAt]], [[deleteRange]], [[append]], [[sort]], [[param]], [[params]], [[arrayIntersect]], [[splitString]], [[joinString]], [[toLower]], [[toUpper]], [[toFixed]], [[endl]], [[format]], [[formatText]], [[toLowerANSI]], [[toUpperANSI]], [http://www.utf8-chartable.de/ Unicode Character Table]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 10, 2015 - 21:05 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Tabs and new lines can be created with [[toString]] [9] and [[toString]] [10], respectively. Alternatively, a new line can also be created with [[toString]] [92,110] ("\n"). If you save these strings into a variable, they can be manipulated like any other string. For example, the following code will work just fine and return the expected output:
<code>_tab = [[toString]] [9];
[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] 3 [[do]]
{
	_tab = _tab + ([[toString]] [9]);
};
[[copyToClipboard]] [[format]] ["x%1x",tab];</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 25, 2015 - 09:58 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
While you can convert any [[String]] to [[Array]] with [[toArray]] command, only numbers from 1 to 55295 (not 65535 as expected) can be successfully converted to [[String]] with [[toString]] and then back to [[Array]] with [[toArray]] without loss of data.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
